author: undetermined
full_text:
ICC Cricket World Cup Winners List From 1975 to 2023 [Australia are Champions]

The 2023 ICC ODI World Cup Champion is Australia, who have beaten India by 6 wickets at Ahmedabad Stadium. This page provides information on the Cricket World Cup Winners List. The Cricket World Cup, officially known as ICC Men's Cricket World Cup, was first organized in 1975 in England. Since then, the tournament has been hosted in different countries based on an unofficial rotation system and is generally held every four years.

Congratulations to Team Australia for Becoming 6 Time Champion in ICC ODI World Cup

As of today, twelve editions of the tournament have been played. Six nations have made it to the ICC Cricket World Cup winners list.

Cricket World Cup Winners From 1975 to 2023 (ODI Format):

1975: West Indies (Host: England)
1979: West Indies (Host: England)
1983: India (Host: England)
1987: Australia (Hosts: India and Pakistan)
1992: Pakistan (Hosts: Australia and New Zealand)
1996: Sri Lanka (Hosts: Pakistan and India)
1999: Australia (Host: England)
2003: Australia (Host: South Africa)
2007: Australia (Host: West Indies)
2011: India (Hosts: India and Bangladesh)
2015: Australia (Hosts: Australia and New Zealand)
2019: England (Hosts: England and Wales)
2023: Australia (Host: India)

Important Points of 2023 ICC ODI World Cup:
- Player of the Series: Virat Kohli
- Most Runs: Virat Kohli
- Most Wickets: Mohammed Shami
- Highest Run: Glenn Maxwell
- Player of the Match in Final: Travis Head

Country-wise World Cup Winners:
- Australia: 6 titles (1987, 1999, 2003, 2007, 2015, 2023)
- West Indies: 2 titles (1975, 1979)
- India: 2 titles (1983, 2011)
- Pakistan: 1 title (1992)
- Sri Lanka: 1 title (1996)
- England: 1 title (2019)

The next ICC Cricket World Cup will be held in 2027 in Zimbabwe, South Africa, and Namibia.

Key Fact: Australia has won the highest number of World Cup titles and remains the most successful team in ODI Cricket World Cup history.
title: Fact: After winning the last 60-over World Cup under Kapil Dev's leadership in 1983, India won the 20-over and 50-over World Cups under MS Dhoni's captaincy in 2007 and 2011 respectively. Interestingly, only the West Indies have a chance of equaling the feat.
vclaim: Australia won the 2023 ICC ODI World Cup by defeating India by 6 wickets at Ahmedabad Stadium. The Cricket World Cup was first held in 1975 in England and has since been played twelve times with six different nations winning the title. Australia holds the record for most World Cup victories with 6 titles (1987, 1999, 2003, 2007, 2015, and 2023). In the 2023 World Cup, Virat Kohli was named Player of the Series and topped the run-scoring charts, while Mohammed Shami took the most wickets. The next ICC Cricket World Cup will be jointly hosted by Zimbabwe, South Africa, and Namibia in 2027.
